body: o.k great. :+1:

i can't get this to work but i think it's almost good.
i've successfully created a google drive api client id and secret key for my uris
when i add a gd storage, i'm well redirected to google grant access page, then it get me back to my owncloud server which claims that my access is authorized.
however, the gd storage remains in red and when i go to my files --> blank page until i remove the gd storage from the administration panel.
i've noticed that in my apache error log, there is the following error :
file does not exist: /var/www/owncloud/owncloud
my oc instance is installed in /var/www/owncloud not in /var/www/owncloud/owncloud, it looks like there is an extra path added.
to access my oc server, i'm using a sub-domain which looks like http://oc.mydomain.com and i'm not using ssl.
regards,
check your owncloud.log. oh and a step i forgot to add is in the api console -> services turn drive api and drive sdk on.

thx a lot michael ! once i've turned on drive api (drive sdk was already on) --> 'works perfectly !
regards
good, i'm waiting for one more user that was testing it before merging.
would test it if it was available as a alpha release. (currently don't have time to build it from src and patch it)
@a-schild http://gapinthecloud.com/googledrive.zip

no luck with the .zip file...

here what google tells me when i try to setup a account (on user-level)

fehler:invalid_client
details anfordern

    response_type=code
    scope=https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive
    redirect_uri=https://aarboard.oncloud7.ch/index.php/settings/personal
    access_type=offline
    approval_prompt=force
    client_id=<my-g+-login>
look at the description above, you need to setup access with the api console. client id is not your google login.

> (i think this needs to be described in the ui when creating the external storage)
i'm going to write a guide for it the documentation

it's too difficult to manage files with duplicate names in a logical way. so, those are expected error messages if it detects a file with a duplicate name in the same folder. nothing bad will happen, it will just ignore it in owncloud. not sure why you can't find the file in google drive at all. 


everything else works? download, renaming, moving?

i see the (initial) files which are on gdrive.
- but when i upload new files to g-drive, they don't show up in owncloud at first, it takes a few minutes until they show up
- same is true when i rename files via g-drive web page, the rename takes a few minutes (2-4) until it shows up in owncloud
- sometimes changes done on g-drive side don't show up at all in owncloud

in the owncloud log file i see almost no messages about g-drive:

{"app":"php","message":"undefined index: content-type at \/home\/aarboard\/cloud\/htdocs\/apps\/files_external\/3rdparty\/goo
gle-api-php-client\/src\/service\/google_mediafileupload.php#99","level":2,"time":"may 28, 2013 07:09:14"}

uploading via webdav->owncloud to the gdrive folder does not work.

here the logfile of the webdav client (total commander in this case)

file send: /remote.php/webdav\googledrive\axiom-api-1.2.7.jar
last upload step: send actual file
put /remote.php/webdav/googledrive/axiom-api-1.2.7.jar http/1.1
content-type: application/octet-stream
content-length: 198321
user-agent: ezdavplugin/2.3 totalcommander/8.0 (windows/8; en_en)
host: aarboard.oncloud7.ch
connection: keep-alive
cache-control: no-cache
cookie: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
******received headers
http/1.1 500 internal server error
date: tue, 28 may 2013 07:58:50 gmt
server: apache/2.2.16 (debian)
x-powered-by: php/5.3.3-7+squeeze15
strict-transport-security: max-age=31536000
expires: thu, 19 nov 1981 08:52:00 gmt
cache-control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0
pragma: no-cache
content-length: 270
connection: close
content-type: application/xml; charset=utf-8
error: 500 internal server error


on the owncloud server i see only this in the logfile:
{"app":"php","message":"undefined index: content-type at \/home\/aarboard\/cloud\/htdocs\/apps\/files_external\/3rdparty\/goo
gle-api-php-client\/src\/service\/google_mediafileupload.php#99","level":2,"time":"may 28, 2013 07:52:06"}
{
it's sort of expected that it will take that long for new stuff to show up in owncloud. i'll look at the upload problem later.

so, i looked into the changes not showing up in owncloud. the problem is that i guess google drive doesn't care about updating the mtime of the root folder at all... so unfortunately with that method of detecting change you might lose a file if you rename it on the google side. i'll try using their changes api https://developers.google.com/drive/v2/reference/changes/list which still isn't very optimal.

@a-schild well, that wasn't much fun thanks to google and their drive api, but i think i solved the problem. could you test it and let me know? it ignores the first batch of changes it gets because i assume the scan just happened which isn't true in your case. so you'll want to go into the folder on owncloud first and then try doing changes on google drive. it isn't the greatest solution, but it's better than always forcing a rescan.

and the upload problem you're experiencing is probably because owncloud couldn't determine the mimetype for your jar file, but it's still their fault. the api shouldn't require the mimetype for upload, but it appears to for this php sdk. i'll report the issue to them about this.
google drive sdk issue: https://code.google.com/p/google-api-php-client/issues/detail?id=327
@mtgap can you build me a current zip for testing?
that's too much work for me. just add https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/8be23efa730e99083bd6ac95f163f9007644db5a to the end of apps/files_external/lib/google.php

@mtgap fyi: i just checked out this branch and gave it a try. quick test shows changes to files on either side do not update the opposite side. i.e rename a file in gdrive and the change isn't propagated into oc and vice versa!

did you guys try the branch with the most recent commit? https://github.com/owncloud/core/commit/8be23efa730e99083bd6ac95f163f9007644db5a 

i spent a whole night working on it and i'm fairly certain it's working correctly.

i've just give a try with the most recent commit and it looks like it's working perfectly now.
thanks a lot
@mtgap send me test credentials and i'll test this one and setup jenkins accordingly - thx

@mtgap thx
that looping was caused by the test enforcing a root with a unique id. @icewind1991 how should i handle this since we aren't creating the root directories in the constructor anymore?
